content: ================================= THE FOLLOWING MEMOS WERE INCLUDED WITH THE PTFS SHIPPED: NONE. In this example, the APARMEMO file was created, but no extra memos are present. You do not see any new information in the APARMEMO file if you did not perform SERVICE against the documentation SERVLINK file because the <prodid> MEMO file is in the documentation SERVLINK file. Chapter 8. Servicing z/VM 273 8.5 Determining the TCP/IP service level Often, you need to query more than the service level. We took the following steps from the CP Maintenance Levels and Virtual Switch TCP/IP Maintenance Levels links, starting at this web page. Complete the following steps: 1. Log on to TCPMAINT on one of the SSI members. Use the QUERY VMLAN command to determine the latest APAR that was applied: ==> query vmlan VMLAN maintenance level: Latest Service: Base VMLAN MAC address assignment: System MAC Protection: OFF MACADDR Prefix: 020211 USER Prefix: 020210 MACIDRANGE SYSTEM: 000001-FFFFFF USER:
